author: Warhammer
description:
The Ultramarines madness gripping Warhammer World has finally ended, and your emails have flooded the UltramarineBlues inbox. Here, we read your UltraMad emails and react to some of the best ones.

title: Sharing Your Ultra-struggles | Reaction | Warhammer 40,000

author: Warhammer
description:
In both Warhammer 40,000 and Age of Sigmar, red skin appears far more often than you might think. Squigs and daemons of Khorne run rampant in both the grim dark future and the Mortal Realms, so knowing how to paint them is a pretty handy skill to have up your sleeve! Tune in to this video to see Ollie show you a few different ways that you can tackle painting the red skin on your miniatures.

Here’s a list of the paints we used in today’s video:

Base:
Mephiston Red

Shade:
Berserker Bloodshade

Layer:
Evil Sunz Scarlet

Contrast:
Baal Red
Blood Angels Red
Flesh Tearers Red

Brushes:
Medium Base
Medium Shade
S Dry

If you enjoyed this and want to learn more, our YouTube channel has an array of beginner-friendly videos to get you started.


Follow for more Warhammer, more often:

- Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/warhammerofficial/
- Threads: https://www.threads.net/@warhammerofficial
- Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WarhammerOfficial/
- Warhammer Community: https://www.warham
title: How to Paint Red Skin | Warhammer
